Fields.DialogueText: U-30? Is that you?
Ja... and you must be the new Kapitän?
Well, yes... but could you come out from behind those pipes so I can see you?
Nein, Kapitän - that won't be necessary. I would prefer to remain in the shadows.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose you submarines do like to stay out of view...
It's dark wherever you go in this U-boat. Don't you think you're being a little dramatic?
This U-boat is tiny. We might as well start getting comfortable with each other.

Fields.DialogueText: U-boats are not designed for comfort, Kapitän. We are designed to approach undetected.
Of course, Kapitän. It is best to avoid unwanted attention.
Staying in the shadows is about function, not drama, Kapitän.
Yes, but the Morganas have really changed the U-boat mission. It's not about sneaking up on merchant ships anymore - hell, I've never even heard of a Morgana cargo ship--
Firing on civilians has always been despicable and unforgivable. I'm ashamed the Kriegsmarine was even considering it before the Nixen arrived...
Well, we don't have to worry about that anymore. Now we just have to sail with the Neutrality Fleet and sink any Morganas we encounter.
Jawohl, Kapitän. We will sink every Nixe we can find to make amends for the things we have done...
... the things we have done?
Ja, Kapitan... the things we have done... Now, let us go find the Nixen!
You're a mysterious one, U-30 - but at least we're on the same page when it comes to fighting Morganas.
By the way, is that a dog back there with you?
He is not just a dog, Kapitän - his name is Schnuffi.
You're taking a dog on patrol with you?
I rescued him from a bad situation. I couldn't just leave him there...
I've got enough things to worry about on this boat - so if you've got that dog on board, he's your responsibility.
Naturally, Kapitän. Now let's get to work...
@BATTLE
The other day you mentioned sinking Morganas to "make amends for the things we have done." What did you mean by that, exactly?
I... I just meant that U-boats have always fought by commerce raiding and attacking merchant ships. It's an uncivilized and inhumane way of waging war.
We're sailors who follow orders, U-30. It's not our job to set policies or plan strategies. Leave those things for the admirals...
But you are an officer, Kapitän! Surely you think of these things? Do you think it is ever right for a U-boat to sink an unarmed civilian ship?

Fields.MenuText: No, of course not!
If a merchant ship supports the war effort of our enemies, then they're combatants too.
If they're on the side of our enemies, then I suppose they're a fair target...

Fields.DialogueText: I am glad we agree, Kapitän.
Would you really feel good about doing something like that?
No, I suppose not.
How about attacking a civilian ship that had nothing to do at all with transporting war materiel?
No, of course that wouldn't be justified.
This war with the Nixen is a way for U-boats to redeem ourselves, Kapitän! We no longer have to play the role of the cutthroat villain, preying on helpless civilians...
We can do the work of heroes and sink the biggest Nixen ships while still remaining in the shadows.
I can't disagree with that, U-30. My responsibility as the captain of this boat is to protect my crew while sinking as many Morgana ships as possible.
I am glad we share the same vision, Kapitän. I see great potential in our partnership...
@BATTLE
We just received an order from HQ. I think you'll find it interesting.
What is it, Kapitän?
There's a huge Morgana fleet roaming around somewhere in our area of operations...
This is nothing new, Kapitän. There are Morganas everywhere these days.
Correct, but HQ says this Morgana fleet is so strong that it's completely battering any Neutrality Fleet ships that run into it.
I see...
The strength of this Morgana fleet relies on a huge battleship with some of the biggest guns we've seen, and it's sailing with dozens of other ships to protect it.
It's been impossible for Neutrality Fleet surface ships to get close enough to even think about hitting that battleship--
So HQ needs a U-boat to sneak through this fleet's defenses to sink that battleship?

Fields.MenuText: Exactly. That's the plan.
It's not going to be easy, but if anyone can do it, it's you, U-30.
Sinking a capital ship would be a huge accomplishment for a U-boat.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's get to work, Kapitän.
Thank you, Kapitän. We'll need a good Kapitän for this as well, and I think that could be you.
I'll do my best, U-30.
Ja, Kapitän. If we are to win this war against the Nixen, we need to take out their biggest ships.
The first challenge will be to find this Morgana fleet. Since they sink any of our ships that run into them, we don't have a good idea of their location.
We just know this fleet is somewhere in the North Sea. All we can do is patrol until we find them - and hopefully take them out after that.
This is our chance to make a difference in this war, Kapitän. We'll put those Nixen on the bottom of the ocean where they belong!
@BATTLE
We've spotted a small group of Morganas ahead, Kapitän.
Arm the torpedoes and fire when in range.
Jawohl, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
We made easy work out of those Nixen thanks to your quick thinking in battle, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: We wouldn't have sunk them if you didn't spot them in the first place.
All I did was give orders. You and the crew did all the hard work.
Well, I did graduate at the top of my class at the academy after all!

Fields.DialogueText: Your talent exceeds your modesty, but I suppose all we're counting are the Morganas we sink...
We make a good team, don't we, Kapitän?
We're lucky to have such a good crew and kapitän.
I'm glad we're all working well together. I admit I was a little anxious when we first met and you wouldn't step out of the shadows.
I don't need to be in the spotlight to get the job done. The only thing that's important to me is sinking the Nixen.
Well, we've got a lot more Nixen to sink together, so I'm looking forward to it!
No sign of that big Morgana fleet yet, but it's good to give the crew a break.
We should still be out there patrolling...
Don't worry - we'll get back out there soon, but these U-boats don't exactly have the longest legs.
What's wrong with my legs, Kapitän? They're not long enough for you?
It's a figure of speech, U-30. Your actual legs look more than adequate to get the job done.
... and what job would that be?
Um... that's another figure of speech. On a related note, how's the resupply going?
It's going well, Kapitän - but would you like me to take a walk around the dock? I can talk to some of the people who've turned out to try to volunteer.

Fields.MenuText: Great idea. We don't have a lot of crew space, but sometimes there are diamonds out there. Put those legs of yours to work.

Fields.DialogueText: There's nothing better than being on patrol, but stretching my legs at port is always a welcome relief. Come along, Schnuffi!
No, this boat is so tiny that we don't have room for any extra supplies.
Hmm... I suppose you're right, Kapitän. It's a tight squeeze inside my hull, isn't it?
Don't blame me - I didn't design it!
Any information from HQ on where we can find this big Morgana fleet that's sinking all of our ships?

Fields.MenuText: No, but they've got an active reconnaissance operation to find it.

Fields.DialogueText: We can't rely on HQ to find anything, Kapitän. They can't find their way out from behind their desks!
Oh, and HQ has decided on a name for this big fleet of Morganas. They've started to call it the "Vanity Fleet."

Fields.MenuText: No, we lose any of our ships that get close enough to make contact.
No, looks like we'll have to find them ourselves.

Fields.DialogueText: Typical, Kapitän. HQ has no idea how to fight a war - they're too busy debating politics and doing paperwork...
This fleet sounds tough, Kapitän - but I'm sure we could beat them!
Well, those Nixen won't be so vain after we pound in their faces, Kapitän!
I didn't know you were so aggressive, U-30! I suppose that's not a bad trait to have in a war...
@BATTLE
What are you doing up here on the deck, U-30?
I'm shadow boxing. There's a lot more room up here to throw a few punches and practice my footwork.
Shadow boxing? Funny enough, I think this might be the first time I've seen you under the sun!
I try to stay out of the sun, Kapitän. I always burn before I tan...

Fields.MenuText: Submarine duty isn't the best way to work on a tan anyway.
Schnuffi doesn't seem to do well in the sun either.
Even a U-boat has to spend some time in the sun to recharge its batteries.

Fields.DialogueText: It's also the time when a U-boat is most vulnerable, Kapitän.
He has a weak constitution, Kapitän. It's unfortunate, but the sun overheats him quickly.
Yes, but the crew does seem to enjoy the fresh air whenever we're on the surface.
I didn't know you were a boxer. What got you interested in boxing?
We Schiffsdamen have to know how to protect ourselves, even in close combat. Besides, it's a good way to build up a healthy constitution.
It is important to stay fit, especially when we're out at sea.
Ja, Kapitän - and it's even more important to know how to throw a punch--
*ALARM*
Scheiße! The lookouts spotted Nixen bombers on the horizon, Kapitän!
Get below deck and prepare to dive!
@BATTLE
I've spotted a few Morganas through the periscope, U-30.
Arming torpedos, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Great work, Kapitän! You're a natural at fighting the Nixen.
I'm just following what I was taught in training. Well, mostly at least - we didn't plan for fighting against Morganas, that's for sure.
I haven't seen any other kapitäne in the Kriegsmarine quite like you, Kapitän. I have been watching you over the last few battles. Your combination of skill in combat and compassion in your heart...

Fields.MenuText: That's very nice praise, but I'm just doing my job.
I'm just an average U-boat captain. I don't know what you're talking about.
Did you hit your head on something? Where are you coming up with this stuff?

Fields.DialogueText: No, Kapitän. You don't need to be modest. There's something special about you...
You're not average, Kapitän. An average kapitän wouldn't have made all those brilliant manuevers in that battle we just fought.
I have seen you actions with my own eyes, and have heard your words through my own ears, Kapitän.
You definitely hit your head on something...
You are destined for greatness, Kapitän. Together we can accomplish so much!
As long as we sink a few Morganas on every patrol, we're doing our part.
We have too much potential together to just settle for a few Morganas. Let's start with sinking this Vanity Fleet, then we can go on to sink every Morgana in the North Sea...
It's always good to set high goals, but sinking every Morgana in the North Sea isn't realistic for one U-boat.
Don't worry, Kapitän - I believe in you. Together we will rid the world of these filthy Nixen...
*BOOM*
That was even closer than the last one, Kapitän.
Yeah...
We're definitely in a mine field.
Just stay calm, U-30.
Naturally. When am I ever not calm, Kapitän?
Only when you're talking about how great your captain is, but I really wish you'd stop doing that - it makes me a little uncomfortable.
But you are a great kapitän, Kapitän! So I'm sure you can get us out of this minefield...

Fields.MenuText: A great captain wouldn't have sailed his boat into a minefield in the first place.
These Morgana minefields are everywhere lately.
We can both celebrate if we get out of here without sinking.

Fields.DialogueText: There's no logic at all to where the Morganas are laying these minefields.
They may slow us down, but they won't stop us, Kapitän!
I always have faith in you, Kapitän.
The safest thing to do is turn around and head back the way we came.
Jawohl, Kapitän. Such a brilliant tactical decision, isn't that right, Schnuffi?
It's just common sense, U-30...
No need to be modest, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Still no information from HQ on the whereabouts of this Vanity Fleet, Kapitän?
No, not since that report of it sinking twelve Neutrality Fleet ships a week ago.
Ach! HQ is so useless. The Vanity Fleet could sail anywhere in the North Sea in a week...
We must patrol more aggressively until we find them, Kapitän!
I'm not sure we can do much more than we're doing now, U-30. It's a big ocean out there, so there's an element of luck in running into the Vanity Fleet - if you want to call it luck.
We can sail faster and stay out at sea longer to cover more territory. We must find them, Kapitän!

Fields.MenuText: We could still miss them even if we did all that.
We're already pushing the boat and crew to their limits with our patrols.
We'll just have to wait for better intel from HQ.

Fields.DialogueText: We can't be so passive, Kapitän! We need to seize the initiative.
It's still no use if we can't find the Vanity Fleet, U-30.
Why are you giving up so easily?
I'm not giving up - I'm just being realistic, U-30.
There has to be a better way to find the Vanity Fleet, Kapitän...
This war won't be won by a single ship. We've got the entire world sailing together in the Neutrality Fleet. We're bound to sink the Vanity Fleet eventually.
But how many lesser kapitäne will the Vanity Fleet sink before it is overcome?
I know you have the talent and skill to destroy the Vanity Fleet, so we must find them before they take even more lives!
Sorry to disappoint you, U-30, but there's no easy solution to this.
There are a few Morganas ahead of us, Kapitän. They're not exactly the Vanity Fleet, but at least we can use them for target practice...
@BATTLE
More shadow boxing, U-30?
Ja, Kapitän. I need to be ready when we finally meet that Vanity Fleet. I'm going to knock their Nixe battleship right out of the water...
Our ships have been struggling to get close enough to fire on that battleship. I'm not sure you'll be able to get into punching distance...
Don't underestimate the abilities of a U-boat to slip under an enemy's guard and deliver a knockout blow, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: That would be an amazing thing to witness, U-30.
It's possible, but it's not going to be easy.
Wait, you're actually planning on punching a battleship?

Fields.DialogueText: Why not, Kapitän? My iron fist could punch right through a battleship's hull.
We'll have to avoid detection for as long as possible, Kapitän. The other ships in the fleet must distract the Nixen so we have enough time to get closer.
We will witness it together, Kapitän, because I can't make it happen without your help.
*BOOM*
Mist! Another Nixen minefield, Kapitan!
Why the hell are Morganas laying these minefields all over the place? It's not like they have any harbors to protect...
I don't understand their reasoning either, Kapitän.
Tell the lookouts to keep an eye out for any more of those things! We need to turn this boat around again...
Ja, Kapitän - but I see Nixen on the horizon too!
@BATTLE
I just talked to HQ, and they have no idea what all these Morgana minefields are about either.
Of course HQ has no idea, Kapitän. Their whole purpose is to know everything that's going on, but I'm sure the average dock worker here has more intel on the war effort than HQ.
Well, they've mapped out all the Morgana minefields that Neutrality Fleet ships have run into. There's no logic at all to how they're placed.
The Nixen must have more logic to their actions than we give them credit for, Kapitän - mindlessly devouring ships can't be their only motivation.

Fields.MenuText: That's all we've seen them do so far, so it's hard to believe otherwise.
I agree with you, but we don't have enough information to suggest anything else.
It doesn't matter what their motivation is - we'll sink all of them soon enough.

Fields.DialogueText: That's right, Kapitän. No Nixe is safe when we're on patrol together.
Then they would be the only navy in the history of the world to fight for no real purpose, Kapitän.
We learn more about them with every battle, Kapitän. The truth will reveal itself soon enough.
Hm. Looks like the resupply is complete, and all of the crew is back. Let's get out to sea and find some more Morganas to sink.
*GUNFIRE*
Nixen approaching the harbor, Kapitän! We'll blow every last one of them to bits...
@BATTLE
It's been a while without fighting any Morganas...
Ja, Kapitan. We haven't even seen any Nixen since we left our last port.
I should have picked up a new book while we were in port. Things have been so slow that I finished my last book two days ago.
Well, if you're bored I could teach you how to shadow box...
We're not scheduled to surface for another six hours. Is there really enough room down here to shadow box?
It'll be a little tight, but there should be just enough space, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure. I might bump my head on something.
I did a little boxing at the academy, but it's been years...
Sounds fun! Where should we start?

Fields.DialogueText: You're a navy officer and a U-boat captain, and you're afraid of a little bump on your head?
I'm sure it'll come back to you quickly, Kapitän. You have many talents, don't you?
First, we'll start with the basic fighting stance...
*BOOM*
Mist! Another mine?!
Maybe...
*BOOM*
Those were close - depth charges, Kapitän?
We'll have to cut the shadow boxing short. It looks like we've got a real fight on our hands!
I'm happy to skip the warmup and head straight in for the knockout, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
I've got an idea, U-30.
What is it, Kapitän?
It's an idea about how we can find the Vanity Fleet.
I see... please go on.
Remember Admiral Scheer's strategy in the Great War?
Admiral Scheer advocated for unrestricted submarine warfare. I have made it clear that I don't approve of that despicable strategy, Kapitän.
No, not that strategy. Scheer also suggested harassing the British coast to lure big British ships out of safe harbors. Once they were in open water, it was easier for German ships to surround them.
Ah, yes - that strategy! But the Nixen do not have harbors of their own, Kapitän.
Correct, but I was thinking about how we can draw the enemy out so we can engage them. We could sail around the North Sea for ages searching for the Vanity Fleet... or we can make them come to us!
Interesting... and how do you suggest we do that?
We stop trying to cover ground on patrol. Instead, we stay in one place, sinking as many Morganas as we can.
The Morganas will continue to call for reinforcements, so the more Morganas we destroy, the more likely it is that the Vanity Fleet will eventually come to help.
I see! Then when the Vanity Fleet finally comes, we slip under their defenses and give that battleship a knockout punch! Genius, Kapitän! I knew you would be the savior of the Neutrality Fleet!

Fields.MenuText: "Savior" is a bit much, but thanks.
The plan is a bit crazy, but it's the only plan I've got.
This war won't be won by just one savior - it'll take the whole Neutrality Fleet!

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly the sort of line that a savior would say, isn't it?
It's true, Kapitän! The other kapitäne are running scared from the Vanity Fleet, but here you are trying to draw it in...
It's bound to work, Kapitän. All the Nixen want to do is swarm our ships, but this time we'll use that against them.
Let's head back to port and load up on supplies. We'll need to stay out a sea for a while for this plan to work.
Ja, Kapitän. The other ships sailing with us can carry extra fuel and torpedoes too - staying out of sight won't be important if all we want to do is attract the Nixen.
Right, and hopefully you won't be too uncomfortable drawing attention for once.
We can dive under the surface when the time is right, Kapitän. That Nixen battleship won't know what hit her...
We've spotted a few Morganas ahead, U-30. Care for a little sparring session before the main event?
@BATTLE
You're looping your hook a little too much, Kapitän.
What do you mean?
You're standing too far away, and trying to hit too much with your arm and shoulder.
Isn't that what punching is all about?
A good hook is compact and short, kapitän. It travels the least possible distance to barely get around the opponent's guard.
The power comes from your legs and your torso. It's about weight transfer, not swinging your arm in a circle. It's short and quick, like this--
*THWACK*
Oww! U-30! I can understand what you're trying to explain without you actually having to punch me in the face!
Mein Gott! Kapitän! I'm so sorry! That was an accident - I just got too into the moment...

Fields.MenuText: It's okay. Accidents happen - but be more careful next time.
I'll have to stay on my toes whenever I'm shadowboxing with you.
Striking an officer? That's a punishable offense!

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän...
I'm so sorry, Kapitän - but that is good advice for boxing in general...
I deserve to be punished, Kapitän...
I have a tendency to strike out accidentally. It's caused me... problems in the past. I - I'm very sorry for hitting you, Kapitän.
Apology accepted, U-30. Just stay a little more focused from now on. Sometimes there are punches that you can't take back.
I'm well aware of that, Kapitän...
Morganas on the horizon, U-30! Let's button up and dive!
@BATTLE
Try to load up as much as possible. This will be the longest patrol we've done yet.
Ja, Kapitän. We're also unloading anything that's not completely necessary. It's only fuel, ammo, and food for this patrol.
Take more fuel than food -  we'll probably have time for fishing when we're sitting in one place waiting for the Vanity Fleet to show up.
Of course, we better be ready once it *does* show up. The fight won't be easy.
If anyone can do it, it's you, Kapitän. You are the savior of the Neutrality Fleet, after all.

Fields.MenuText: I wish you wouldn't sound so serious when you say that. It's a little... creepy.
I'm just an average captain. There's nothing special about me.
Don't worry, I'm ready to shoulder the responsibility of saving us all.

Fields.DialogueText: It's the truth, Kapitän - and it's not scary at all. I've got faith in you.
The numbers don't lie, Kapitän - we've sunk more Nixen than any other U-boat in the North Sea.
I knew I could trust you, Kapitän.
It doesn't matter what you call me - what's important is that we find every last Morgana in the North Sea and blow them out of the water.
Jawohl, Kapitän. We just finished the resupply, so let's get back out there and start fishing for that Vanity Fleet...
@BATTLE
We're nearly in position, U-30.
Ja, Kapitän - I'm ready to go all 15 rounds if that's how long it takes to attract the Vanity Fleet.
You can take your gloves off for this one - unless you're using that big metal one, of course. How does that thing work, anyway?
My iron fist? It's not very complicated to operate, Kapitän. I can show you--
You don't have to show me down here, U-30. Last time you threw a punch, you hit me square in the jaw with a left hook.
I'm still sorry about that, Kapitän. Sometimes I just lose control without thinking...

Fields.MenuText: You've been pretty sharp on our patrols together.
Everyone loses concentration once in a while.
This is a U-boat, U-30. Accidents happen and people can die if you're not paying attention.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to remind me about that, Kapitän...
Thank you, Kapitän. I'm trying my best to improve on past mistakes...
It's inexcusable for a Schiffsdame to have a lapse in concentration, Kapitän. There are too many things that can go wrong on a U-boat...
Well, every new patrol is a chance to start over. Consider it a baptism of sorts whenever we leave the dock.
Ja... ja, Kapitän! A baptism... I really can start over with the help of my savior. It's time for me to atone for my past sins!
I didn't mean it quite so literally...
We have some Nixen ahead, Kapitän. Let us repent by cleansing the seas of these demons!
@BATTLE
We're here, U-30.
Ja, Kapitän. So the plan is to engage the Nixen in this area, then continue to draw in more of their ships until the Vanity Fleet arrives?
That's right. It's a simple enough plan, so it might actually work.
There is always chaos in battle, Kapitän, but I am sure your leadership will allow us to triumph over adversity.

Fields.MenuText: Why do you believe in me so strongly, U-30?
I haven't done anything special to earn all this praise from you.
I've managed to get us this far, so why not go for the knockout?

Fields.DialogueText: You have strong morals, and you're a quick thinker during battle, Kapitän. You're dedicated to your crew and mission.
You earn my praise every day with your hard work and the way you take care of the crew.
Ja, Kapitän! We're so close to victory over this Vanity Fleet!
I was at a very low point when you became my kapitän. I was so ashamed of my past, but together we have turned the tide of the war and destroyed dozens of our enemy's ships.
So you rescued me when I was lost in a sea of despair - that is why you are my savior.
But you don't have to stop with saving just me, Kapitän! We can save so many others by sending this Vanity Fleet to the bottom of the ocean where they belong.
I didn't know I meant that much to you, U-30. I was just--
*BOOM*
The Nixen have arrived! They're coming out swinging, Kapitän...
@BATTLE
That was a tough fight, but we made it through the first round.
Ja, Kapitän - but the aggression of the Nixen will be their downfall once we draw in the Vanity Fleet.
*BOOM*
The strategy is working, U-30 - looks like more Morganas are starting to arrive.
Ja, Kapitän... I hope we can stand up to them...

Fields.MenuText: Of course we can! Nothing can stop us when we're working together!
Since when did you start doubting yourself? We'll sink every Morgana that comes our way.
Maybe this whole strategy was a bad idea...

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Kapitän! I lost my concentration for a moment, but you're right.
Ja, Kapitän! I must remember to keep faith in our abilities.
Kapitän, now is not the time to question ourselves. We must be confident to win any fight we take.
You're right. We'll get through this together.
*BOOM*
More depth charges... it's only a matter of time before one of them hits us.
We have to take these Morganas out fast so we don't get overwhelmed. Get those torpedoes in the water!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
More Nixen, Kapitän!
The strategy is working - we keep on attracting tougher Morganas.
*BOOM*
I hope the Vanity Fleet shows up sooner rather than later, Kapitän. We've had too many close calls already.
We need to keep ducking and weaving to avoid these depth charges and buy us a little more time...
Ja, Kapitän! Schnuffi doesn't appreciate all the loud noise either.

Fields.MenuText: You're worried about a dog's feelings at a time like this?
If a depth charge punches a hole in our hull, none of us will be hearing very much!
We'll take these Morganas out quickly - for Schnuffi's sake.

Fields.DialogueText: He's an important part of the crew, Kapitän!
Ja, Kapitän - we will continue to zigzag while firing back at those Nixen!
Schnuffi would greatly appreciate that, Kapitän.
So would I - now get those torpedoes in the water!
We've fired a lot of torpedoes already - we need to resupply soon, Kapitän.
We can surface once it's safe. The supply ships on the surface have plenty more torpedoes for us. We need to take care of these Morganas before we do anything though.
We'll have to make every shot then, isn't that right, Schnuffi?
@BATTLE
We just loaded the last torpedo, Kapitän. We've got enough ammunition for a few more rounds in the ring.
Great. Get the lookouts below deck and prepare to dive.
Ja, Kapitän.
The lookouts sighted what looks like a huge Morgana battleship on the horizon.
Could it be... the Vanity Fleet?

Fields.MenuText: I think so. It's about time she showed up...
Whatever fleet it is, that battleship won't go down without a fight.
We won't know for sure until we get close enough to sink them.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll pound her to bits just like all the others, Kapitän...
I can't wait to smash my fist right through her bow, Kapitän...
We'll slip through her guard and knock her lights out cold, Kapitän...
You've certainly got a dark side to you, don't you, U-30?
I've always lived my life in the shadows.
*BOOM*
We need to dive, U-30!
Jawohl, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
The guns on that Vanity Fleet battleship are so big that we can't get close enough to hit her.
We can sail under their front line and get closer to her, Kapitän.
It's too dangerous - they're dropping too many depth charges. That battleship is firing and keeping her distance too - she knows what she's doing and there's no way we can run her down.
It's tough to fight an opponent with a longer reach. We can't take her head on - there has to be another way, Kapitän...

Fields.MenuText: We're struggling to damage the Vanity Fleet - just like everyone else.
I hadn't really thought about how to sink her once she got here...
Any ideas? I'm completely out of them.

Fields.DialogueText: You're not just like everyone else, Kapitän - you're our savior! Think of something!
A direct attack is useless. You'll have to be creative, Kapitän.
You're the kapitän, Kapitän! I'm sure you can think of something...
Hmm...
*BOOM*
Maybe...
*BOOM*
Kapitän! We don't have any more time for thinking - we need to act!
I've got it! Let's take out these Morganas just ahead first - we'll need the room to maneuver.
Jawohl, Kapitän! I knew you'd come up with something!
@BATTLE
So what's your plan to get close enough to that battleship, Kapitän?
Take a look at this chart from HQ, U-30.
That useless map of all the Nixen minefields? HQ was never able to figure out the logic behind where the Nixen placed them...
It doesn't matter why they placed them - look at where we are now, and where the Vanity Fleet is positioned.
We are flanked on two sides by Nixen minefields...
Exactly! And the thing about minefields is that they restrict their own movement as much as ours...
So while their screen of destroyers and cruisers are dropping too many depth charges for us to go straight in for the battleship, we can sail around their flank...
... and pin that battleship against her own minefields. With nowhere to run, she's got no advantage with her range, and we torpedo her until she goes down!
So we throw a hook around her guard, pin her against the ropes, neutralize her longer reach, and pound her until she drops to the canvas?
Brilliant, Kapitän! I shouldn't have doubted that our savior would come up with such an amazing tatcial plan!

Fields.MenuText: All in a days work, U-30. Now let's make this plan happen!
I haven't saved anyone until we get out of this engagement alive.
I did learn a thing or two from your boxing lessons. My jaw is still a bit sore...

Fields.DialogueText: Jawohl, Kapitän! I've been practicing my footwork for just such an occasion. We'll sail around their flank and deal a knockout blow!
Don't worry - I'm not leaving this one up to the judges' scorecards. That battleship is as good as dead.
You have to take a few hits to learn anything about fighting, Kapitän. Although I still feel bad about hitting you...
Let's start maneuvering around their line then - we've been sitting in one place for too long anyway.
You said U-boats don't have long legs, Kapitän, but we can still move fast when we have to!
Let's throw a quick hook and knock this Morgana out!
@BATTLE
I've got that battleship in view on the periscope.
Is she starting to move, Kapitän?
Looks like it. Her strategy is to fire while keeping us just far enough away so we can't shoot back...
... but we've got her moving, and she's going to get wedged right in between those two Morgana minefields.
She'll have nowhere to run once we've pinned her on the ropes. Then I'll go in for the kill, Kapitän. It's going to be a bloodbath...

Fields.MenuText: Everything's going according to plan.
You really enjoy sinking Morganas, don't you?
Got a lot of pent up anger?

Fields.DialogueText: It's such an ingenious plan you came up with, Kapitän. You'll save us all from this Morgana scourge...
There is so much evil in this world, Kapitän. If we don't cleanse ourselves of it, how will we ever find peace?
I've been saving it for the Vanity Fleet, Kapitän. They've already killed so many sailors... they cannot be forgiven.
Don't worry, U-30 - soon we'll have them right where we want them, and there'll be nowhere else for them to run.
It'll be a Nixen bloodbath - isn't that right, Schnuffi?
You're a strange one, U-30 - but I'm just glad you're on our side.
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
What was that, Kapitän? Can you see anything through the periscope?
Looks like their battleship just sailed into one of their own minefields, U-30!
Your plan is working! You really are a savior...
We can debate this whole savior thing later, but right now we need to dive and head straight for that battleship!
Ja, Kapitän. We're running low on torpedoes though...

Fields.MenuText: We don't have time to resupply. We need to attack with what we've got.
Make every shot count. We can't afford to miss.
What can we do if we run out of torpedoes?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän - I agree... but it will be difficult if we run out of ammunition...
Of course, Kapitän. No feints this time - only power punches!
The deck gun will be useless against a battleship that big...
There's no turning back now, U-30. Let's throw everything we have at that battleship!
Ja, Kapitän, but we don't have much more! I'm not sure we have what it takes to sink her!
You've always believed in me, U-30 - so I'm not going to stop believing in you! Go in for the knockout!
Jawohl, Kapitän! I'll give it everything I've got!
@BATTLE
We're almost out of torpedoes, U-30!
It's insane to surface and try to take out a battleship with our deck guns, Kapitän!
We don't have any other options if we're out of torpedoes - unless you think we can survive ramming a battleship!
Scheiße! Just keep firing, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
*GUNFIRE*
We've almost taken her out, but that battleship is still afloat, U-30! She's still firing her guns on our ships!
We're close enough to touch her, Kapitän! Come alongside her!
We're not going to survive ramming her, U-30!
Nein, Kapitän! Just come alongside her - don't ram her. I'm going to finally giver her that knockout punch!
You got it, U-30!
*THWACK*
*CREEEEAK*
*RUMBLE*
You punched straight through her hull, U-30! She's taking on water fast!
I'll see you underwater, Vanity! We finally did it, Kapitän! You really are the savior of the Neutrality Fleet now!

Fields.MenuText: I'm no savior, U-30. I'm just lucky to have the best U-boat crew on the North Sea.
It must be fate that put us together, because you just saved me too, U-30.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I feel like our crew can knock out anyone when you're in our corner, Kapitän!
Oh... do you really feel that way, Kapitän? I... I don't know what to say...
I do feel like Schnuffi needs to ship up a bit though. If he's going to be part of our crew, he needs to start pulling his own weight around here.
He is pulling his own weight as the ship's mascot, Kapitän!
Hmm... I suppose he doesn't weigh that much to begin with...
Vanity is sinking pretty fast, Kapitän. What's next for us?
Well, you did want to sink every Morgana in the North Sea, so we've got some more work to do.
You don't have to say anything. We'll have plenty of time to talk later, because I always want to be by your side.
That's exactly what a savior would say, Kapitän! I knew I was right about you... isn't that right, Schnuffi?
